question: A researcher notices differences in the shapes of leaves on different trees of the same species. Which of these is the most accurate way to record these differences?
candidate_answers: (A) record the numbers of leaves in a data table (B) photograph each leaf type using a camera (C) record the sizes of different leaves in a notebook (D) calculate the percentages of all leaf types using a calculator
answer: photograph each leaf type using a camera
label: B
